summary: A mentally turbulent day marked by intense emotional swings, work-related stress, and relationship conflict. Experienced panic attacks, suicidal ideation, and deep personal unrest. Despite this, managed to execute office work and reflected meaningfully on patterns and coping mechanisms.

wins: Despite internal chaos, continued work execution with reasonable energy.
Reduced cigarette count to 5â€“10, showing progress from previous highs.
losses: Triggered into a rage-panic spiral due to office pressure and Tanvi conflict.
Experienced suicidal ideation and deep emotional dysregulation.
Fell back into old relational patterns (manipulation, no direction, resentment).
ideas: Recognized the bounce-back ability after panic episodes, even without full emotional resolution.
Noted the danger of accumulated small frustrations leading to breakdown.
Began observing that social anxiety and work stress are entangled in a repeating loop.

goals: Find actionable strategies to interrupt destructive relational patterns.
Stabilize emotional volatility without depending on suppression or pure willpower.
Continue reducing cigarettes as a metric of self-control progress.
triggerEvents: Tanvi's reaction triggered unresolved patterns and panic.
Office workload and emotional turbulence caused cognitive overload.
